title: Album Page, "Elevation of Left Half of Shield from Statue of Colleoni, Venice", late 19th century
medium: Graphite on thick off-white wove paper with untrimmed edges, folded, tipped into binding with fabric
markings: Watermark: left side of sheet: C inscribed in shield;  right side of sheet: six-pointed star / De More (?)
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, upper right: center end; to right of drawing: appears to be a fleur on end / very indr. . . . Verso of sheet, in graphite, upper right corner: 113; lower right: Bas reliefs on / Coleoni [sic] statue / Venice; upper right
dimensions: Sheet: 60 x 42 cm (23 5/8 x 16 9/16 in.), approximate
description: Vertical sheet folded and tipped upside down into binding depicting a sketch (possibly full size) of the left side of a shield.  The shield appears to lay over the haunch of an animal, and has part of a garland and swag above and to the left of it. The top of the shield terminates in what is possibly a fleur de lis.

tombstone.epitaph: Album Page, "Elevation of Left Half of Shield from Statue of Colleoni, Venice", late 19th century.Graphite on thick off-white wove paper with untrimmed edges, folded, tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-278.
